creditline: Gift of Paul Bennie and Scholten Japanese Art, NY
description: view of the Grand Canyon; rust, salmon, olive, tan, blues, grey, yellow; yellow line at horizon; grey sky; high horizon line
inscription: bottom margin in pencil: 25/100 | LLC in pencil: Cloud Shadows, Grand Canyon
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
signed: LRC in pencil: Paul Binnie | bottom center embossed: Binnie
text: After receiving his training in Edinburgh and Paris, Scotland born artist Paul Binnie moved to Japan in 1993 to study woodblock printing. His work is greatly informed by modern Japanese print artists in the shin-hanga movement—artists such as Kawase Hasui, Ito Shinsui, and Natori Shunsen—and his work has taken up subjects often found therein, including actors, beautiful women, and landscapes. The present landscape print is Binnie’s largest to date and was inspired by the work of Yoshida Hiroshi (1876–1950). It is intended to be the first of a series of prints that will revisit locations pictured by Yoshida in the 1920s and 30s.
title: Travels with the Master: Cloud Shadows, Grand Canyon (Meishou To No Tabi: Guranndo Kyanionn)
